description: From Ottoman Turkish پلاو‎ (modern Turkish pilav), from Persian پلاو‎ (pelâv), from Hindi पुलाव (pulāv)/Urdu پُلاؤ‎ (pulāo), from Sanskrit पुलाक (pulāka), which is probably of Dravidian origin.  Akin to Tamil புழுக்கு (puḻukku, “cooked rice”).

entries.meaning: A dish made by browning grain, typically rice, in oil and then cooking it with a seasoned broth, to which meat and/or vegetables may be added.
